member.name: T:Bat_launcher.AlreadyRunningException
member.summary: Exception thrown by AsyncUtils.AsyncOperation.Start when an operation is already in progress.

member.name: T:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation
member.summary: This base class is designed to be used by lengthy operations that wish to support cancellation. It also allows those operations to invoke delegates on the UI Thread of a hosting control.
member.remarks: This class is from the MSDN article: http://msdn.microsoft.com/msdnmag/issues/03/02/Multithreading/default.aspx (C) 2001-2002 I D Griffiths Please see the article for a complete description of the intentions and operation of this class.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.ISynchronizeInvoke)
member.summary: Initialises an AsyncOperation with an association to the supplied ISynchronizeInvoke. All events raised from this object will be delivered via this target. (This might be a Control object, so events would be delivered to that Control's UI thread.)
member.param: An object implementing the ISynchronizeInvoke interface. All events will be delivered through this target, ensuring that they are delivered to the correct thread.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.Start
member.summary: Launch the operation on a worker thread. This method will return immediately, and the operation will start asynchronously on a worker thread.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.Cancel
member.summary: Attempt to cancel the current operation. This returns immediately to the caller. No guarantee is made as to whether the operation will be successfully cancelled. All that can be known is that at some point, one of the three events Completed, Cancelled, or Failed will be raised at some point.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.CancelAndWait
member.summary: Attempt to cancel the current operation and block until either the cancellation succeeds or the operation completes.
member.returns: true if the operation was successfully cancelled or it failed, false if it ran to completion.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.WaitUntilDone
member.summary: Blocks until the operation has either run to completion, or has been successfully cancelled, or has failed with an internal exception.
member.returns: true if the operation completed, false if it was cancelled before completion or failed with an internal exception.

member.name: P:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.IsDone
member.summary: Returns false if the operation is still in progress, or true if it has either completed successfully, been cancelled successfully, or failed with an internal exception.

member.name: E:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.Completed
member.summary: This event will be fired if the operation runs to completion without being cancelled. This event will be raised through the ISynchronizeTarget supplied at construction time. Note that this event may still be received after a cancellation request has been issued. (This would happen if the operation completed at about the same time that cancellation was requested.) But the event is not raised if the operation is cancelled successfully.

member.name: E:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.Cancelled
member.summary: This event will be fired when the operation is successfully stoped through cancellation. This event will be raised through the ISynchronizeTarget supplied at construction time.

member.name: E:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.Failed
member.summary: This event will be fired if the operation throws an exception. This event will be raised through the ISynchronizeTarget supplied at construction time.

member.name: P:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.Target
member.summary: The ISynchronizeTarget supplied during construction - this can be used by deriving classes which wish to add their own events.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.DoWork
member.summary: To be overridden by the deriving class - this is where the work will be done. The base class calls this method on a worker thread when the Start method is called.

member.name: P:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.CancelRequested
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the request has been cancelled. Long- running operations should check this flag regularly if they can and cancel their operations as soon as they notice that it has been set.

member.name: P:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.HasCompleted
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the request has run through to completion. This will be false if the request has been successfully cancelled, or if it failed.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.AcknowledgeCancel
member.summary: This is called by the operation when it wants to indicate that it saw the cancellation request and honoured it.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AsyncOperation.FireAsync(System.Delegate,System.Object[])
member.summary: Utility function for firing an event through the target. It uses C#'s variable length parameter list support to build the parameter list. This functions presumes that the caller holds the object lock. (This is because the event list is typically modified on the UI thread, but events are usually raised on the worker thread.)

member.name: T:Bat_launcher.DataReceivedHandler
member.summary: Delegate used by the events StdOutReceived and StdErrReceived...

member.name: T:Bat_launcher.DataReceivedEventArgs
member.summary: Event Args for above delegate

member.name: F:Bat_launcher.DataReceivedEventArgs.Text
member.summary: The text that was received

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.DataReceivedEventArgs.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The text that was received for this event to be triggered.

member.name: T:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller
member.summary: This class can launch a process (like a bat file, perl script, etc) and return all of the StdOut and StdErr to GUI app for display in textboxes, etc.
member.remarks: This class (c) 2003 Michael Mayer Use it as you like (public domain licensing). Please post any bugs / fixes to the page where you downloaded this code.

member.name: F:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.FileName
member.summary: The command to run (should be made into a property)

member.name: F:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.Arguments
member.summary: The Arguments for the cmd (should be made into a property)

member.name: F:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: The WorkingDirectory (should be made into a property)

member.name: E:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.StdOutReceived
member.summary: Fired for every line of stdOut received.

member.name: E:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.StdErrReceived
member.summary: Fired for every line of stdErr received.

member.name: F:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.SleepTime
member.summary: Amount of time to sleep on threads while waiting for the process to finish.

member.name: F:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.process
member.summary: The process used to run your task

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.ISynchronizeInvoke)
member.summary: Initialises a ProcessCaller with an association to the supplied ISynchronizeInvoke. All events raised from this object will be delivered via this target. (This might be a Control object, so events would be delivered to that Control's UI thread.)
member.param: An object implementing the ISynchronizeInvoke interface. All events will be delivered through this target, ensuring that they are delivered to the correct thread.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.DoWork
member.summary: Launch a process, but do not return until the process has exited. That way we can kill the process if a cancel is requested.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.StartProcess
member.summary: This method is generally called by DoWork() which is called by the base classs Start()

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.ReadStdOut
member.summary: Handles reading of stdout and firing an event for every line read

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.ProcessCaller.ReadStdErr
member.summary: Handles reading of stdErr

member.name: T:Bat_launcher.AceNewzForm
member.summary: A simple form to launch a process using ProcessCaller and display all StdOut and StdErr in a RichTextBox.
member.remarks: Special thanks to Chad Christensen for suggestions on using the RichTextBox. Note there are a lot of issues with scrolling on a RichTextBox, depending upon if the cursor (selection point) is in the RichTextBox or not, and if it is hidden or not. I've disabled the RichTextBox tabstop so that the cursor isn't automatically placed in the text box. Now setting or unsetting: richTextBox1.HideSelection will affect if the textbox is always repositioned at the bottom when new text is entered.

member.name: F:Bat_launcher.AceNewzForm.components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AceNewzForm.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AceNewzForm.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AceNewzForm.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: M:Bat_launcher.AceNewzForm.writeStreamInfo(System.Object,Bat_launcher.DataReceivedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the events of StdErrReceived and StdOutReceived.
member.remarks: If stderr were handled in a separate function, it could possibly be displayed in red in the richText box, but that is beyond the scope of this demo.

member.name: T:Bat_launcher.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Bat_launcher.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Bat_launcher.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry
member.summary: An useful class to read/write/delete/count registry keys

member.name: P:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry.ShowError
member.summary: A property to show or hide error messages (default = false)

member.name: P:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry.SubKey
member.summary: A property to set the SubKey value (default = "SOFTWARE\\" + Application.ProductName.ToUpper())

member.name: P:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry.BaseRegistryKey
member.summary: A property to set the BaseRegistryKey value. (default = Registry.LocalMachine)

member.name: M:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry.Read(System.String)
member.summary: To read a registry key. input: KeyName (string) output: value (string)

member.name: M:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry.Write(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: To write into a registry key. input: KeyName (string) , Value (object) output: true or false

member.name: M:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry.DeleteKey(System.String)
member.summary: To delete a registry key. input: KeyName (string) output: true or false

member.name: M:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry.DeleteSubKeyTree
member.summary: To delete a sub key and any child. input: void output: true or false

member.name: M:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry.SubKeyCount
member.summary: Retrive the count of subkeys at the current key. input: void output: number of subkeys

member.name: M:Utility.ModifyRegistry.ModifyRegistry.ValueCount
member.summary: Retrive the count of values in the key. input: void output: number of keys
